name: Aspect Tamar Valley Resort

reviews.text: While this may be a family oriented 'resort' it should cater for other types of guest also. The quirky factor is definitely there, however its not everyone's cup of tea. The grounds are nice and well maintained and the neighbourhood does look the part - swiss alpine village - not sure what this is doing in Tasmania. We stayed in an apartment style room which was spacious but cold. Dinner at the restaurant was not great and breakfast disappointing. The resort is quite a drive out of town. Its probably more suitable for conferences/weddings etc rather than for tourists travelling around unless you are into golf or mini-golf!
reviews.title: Quirkyness can't save it....

likes.liked: — the setting and some staff were excellent, but not all.

reviews.text: Only stayed one night but thought the resort was wonderful. We stayed in a hotel room and it only cost $122.00 for myself, my husband and teenage son. The room was very clean and comfortable. The front of desk staff very professional. The breakfast was reasonable and satisfying. We had a lovely meal at the Rosevears Tavern which is about a ten minute drive away. All in all a great night.
reviews.title: Great value for money

likes.liked: — The standard of the room and the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this resort as a matter of curiosity as we couldn't find many photos of the rooms on the internet. The drive to the resort was very pleasant and the views were spectacular. As you arrive closer to the resort, you notice the other houses nearby which are 'swiss style' in design. When we arrived, check in was quick and easy and we were very surprised by the quality of our room. It was wonderful and it is a shame there are not more photos of the hotel section available for people to view. There is a lovely sweeping staircase which leads up to the top floor of the hotel which is were we stayed. We loved the purple feature walls and the decor was excellent. We dined at the restaurant for tea and it was wonderful. The food and service was fantastic and they even let us take a chocolate mousse back to our room. There are many activities to participate in at the resort, however they are pricey and it is a shame there are hardly any complementary activities for hotel guests. Following a fantastic meal at the hotel we had high hopes for breakfast, but unfortunately it was not what we had expected. If this wasn't included as part of our deal, we would have given this a miss. Probably more suited to families. All in all a fantastic place to stay and staff are very obliging. We highly recommend.
reviews.title: Surprise Package

reviews.text: I booked a Vista Chalet directly thru the resort's website and got it quite cheaply, $114 for a 2 storey full contained house with a double & 3 singles! We only stayed 2 nights but it had a full kitchen and a laundry, perfect for longer stays.
reviews.title: Great for families & great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was a quite painful. The woman on the desk was quite rude and insisted she didn't have my booking, even though I had a printed email confirmation in my hand. Then she found it and said that I hadn't paid, even though it had been paid in full in advance. She also proceeded to serve several other guests whilst "resolving" my issues and ignoring me the whole time. I was certainly not impressed. That said she was the only downside to our stay.
reviews.title: Quirky!

likes.liked: — Price and something a bit different from the usual hotel!
likes.disliked: — Quite old and a bit rundown

reviews.text: i stayed in a hideaway chalet for one night. The chalet had everything you would need - from cutlery/crockery to a washing machine and dryer. 2 bedrooms (queen bed and 2 singles). Very clean and spacious. The resort itself was gorgeous - well maintained gardens, indoor pool, mini golf. The swiss shopping village is very unique - little stores such as a bakery, chocolate shop, souveniers, newsagency. very nice setting. We only ate at the restaurant for breakfast - hot buffet breakfast was $16.90 per person (i think it was cheaper for kids). Staff were friendly and helpful. I would definately stay here again. great place for families - lots of things for the kids to do. It's about 15 mins out of town but there are supermarkets etc located close by.
reviews.title: would stay here again!!

reviews.text: Liked our stay in a hideaway cottage..Fantastic Value paid under £50 for the accom. Only gripe was the poor service in the restaurant & the food itself was mediocre. If I went there again I would eat out ... even breakfast wasnt that good ..sorry!
reviews.title: Interesting spot

reviews.text: I had been in Launceston for work and my wife flew down and we had a look around Tasmania for a few days instead of staying back in launceston I took a punt on trying somewhere site unseen booked on wotif and took the mysery upgrade option 2 nights under Aust $95 each night nice clean rooms and ensuite bathroom with big spa very quiet location the hotel onsite was very nice and the pricing for meals and breakfast were pretty standard. but below what I was charged in launceston It was in the middle of winter and the rooms and hotel were warm. but we only saw the staff and 5 other people there. so it may be different when busy would be a great location with younger kids as it also has stand alone chalets We had had some intersting accomodation on this trip as I booked it all on wotif and found some places were not as described. But would recommend this place as the best in the price range that w e used in Tasmania
reviews.title: Lovely Place

likes.disliked: — distance from the city centre you would need a car dont know of any other transport options

reviews.text: We stayed in an Alpine chalet at the resort during July. There was plenty of room for myself, my husband , two teenagers and our 3 year old. We booked through Wotif and got an excellent price. The chalet was very well maintained with full kitchen facilities and a washing machine and dryer.
reviews.title: Awesome family accommodation

likes.liked: — Lotys of room for five people

reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay, will be back
reviews.text: It was the middle of July and freezing cold outside but the chalet was very well heated and we didn't even need to use the electric blankets.

description: Aspect Tamar Valley Resort provides great accommodation, activities, shopping, lakeside dining, golfing and Freshview Day Spa. The resort boasts World Class facilities in arguably Tasmania's most exclusive and exotic suburb.The resort is set on over 150 magnificent acres amid numerous spectacular lakes with breathtaking views and fosters an engaging timeless ambience rarely found.Aspect Tamar Valley Resort is perfectly located about 15 minutes drive north of Launceston and is a true Jewel in the crown of this breathtaking region.Aspect Tamar Valley Resort is ideally positioned to use as a base whilst exploringall that Northern Tasmania has to offer.
